basics.name: Valentin Kapitany
basics.label: Researcher, Computer Vision
basics.summary: I specialise in both traditional and machine learning enabled computer vision for smart microscopy as a Research Associate at the University of Glasgow. In parallel, I've enhanced edge devices with AI, notably for concealed weapon detection in smart home security and 3D human motion tracking. In five years of data science, I've refined skills across the spectrum â€“ from developing and deploying data pipelines and ML models, to storytelling through compelling visual narratives. I excel at extracting vital insights from haystacks of data, aiming to mould a more efficient, sustainable, and healthier future.

work.name: University of Glasgow
highlights: Created a data-driven algorithm that improves image resolution by up to 98%, per the LPIPS metric, using noise reduction, image registration and deep-learning based super-resolution in Python.

Improved concealed weapon detection error rate by 400% using 1300 times less memory, by optimising an AI-enabled edge-device consisting of 3D cameras (LiDAR) and radars powered by a Raspberry Pi, running TensorFlow Lite in C.
